page.title: 17THE ANDOVER REDBRIDGE CANAL
page.content: The{Old Canal}is almost{191}years old and it took barges from{Andover}to {Redbridge}in{Southampton}carrying food and livestock. The construction was started in July 1789 and it was finished in January 1794 .Now the old canal is filled with flowers , weeds and trees. The most popular flower there is the{Yellow Iris.}The canal was first called The Navigable canal and it went from Andover to Redbridge in the county of Southampton.The canal is 22 miles 4 furlongs and 9 chains long. However, it was only used for 20 or 30 years before falling into disuse. Most of the old canal is now wet and boggy. A small section of the canal can still be seen at{Lee}near{Romsey , Hampshire
